content: 2dc ch2 2dc into chain 2 space skip 2 st repeat to last chain 2 space 2dc ch2 2dc into last chain 2 space skip 1 st double_crochet into last st 2 double_crochet into top of turning chain stitch count =90 96 120 132 stitches row 3 chain 3 2 double_crochet into first st double_crochet into next st skip 2 st *double_crochet into next st 2dc chain 2 2dc into chain 2 space double_crochet into next st skip 2 st repeat from * to last st 2 double_crochet into next st 2 double_crochet turning chain stitch count = 120 128 160 176 stitches row 4 chain 3 2 double_crochet into first st double_crochet into next 2 st skip 2 st *double_crochet into next 2 st 2dc chain 2 2dc into chain 2 space double_crochet into next 2 st skip 2 st repeat from *to last 2 st double_crochet into next st 2 double_crochet into last st 2 double_crochet into top of turning chain stitch count = 150 160 200 220 stitches row 5 chain 3 double_crochet into first st double_crochet into next 3 st skip 2 st *double_crochet into next 3 st 1dc chain 2 1dc into chain 2 space double_crochet into next 3 st skip 2 st repeat from *to last 3 st double_crochet into next 3 st 2 double_crochet into top of turning chain stitch count = 150 160 200 220 stitches row 5 establishes the peephole chevron stitch pattern repeat row 5 until yoke measures required depth to underarm try it on to determine this chevron lace cardigan modified 24/12/09 2 © http //www milobo wordpress con all rights reserved divide yoke into body and sleeve sections place first marker following 20 25 30 35 stitches second marker following 50 55 70 75 stitches third marker following 100 105 130 145 stitches and fourth marker following 130 135 170 185 stitches the yoke is now marked out as follows first front first sleeve back 2nd sleeve 2nd front chain for underarms with new ball of yarn join with a slip_stitch to top of first marked stitch chain 10 and join with a slipstitch to 2nd marked stitch break yarn and rejoin with a slip_stitch to 3rd marked stitch chain 10 and join with a slip_stitch to 4th marked stitch break yarn each chain 10 will represent one pattern repeat of 10 stitches at the underarm body with original yarn work in pattern across first front skip sleeve stitches and work in pattern across first chain 10 treating each chain as if it was a stitch in the row below work in pattern across back stitches skip sleeve stitches and work in pattern across 2nd chain 10 work in pattern across 2nd front work in pattern across these stitches until body is desired length and fasten_off sleeves rejoin yarn to 7th 6th 7th 6th chain of underarm sections chain 3 counts as 1st double_crochet and work in pattern across sleeve stitches at end of row join with a
